website_summaries.verdict: The feature-packed and waterproof Polar M400 offers a good set of features for beginners and advanced runners a like. It also provides feedback on your daily activities and sleep.
pros: The Polar M400 has good battery life, can sync wirelessly with your phone, includes GPS and activity tracking, charges through a normal Micro-USB and supports wireless heart-rate monitors
It also has automatic sleep tracking, an always-on display with a backlight, inactivity alerts and is waterproof
cons: The big design may not be appropriate for all environments
There's no vibration for alerts or a silent alarm

customer_reviews.title: Design Defect - Micro USB Port Fails Quickly
customer_reviews.text: My wife loved this GPS sports watch, but like so many other purchasers we have discovered, within two months the micro USB port failed and the watch will now not take a charge or sync. We contacted Polar Customer Service for a replacement, but that will take a few weeks. Who wants to pay so much for product that is obviously defective in design? Polar should recall the M400 and give purchasers a product that works. Those of you looking at the new Polar A360, beware. The A360 has the same micro USB port and could be just as probe to failure as the M400.
customer_reviews.author: AugsburgTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Best GPS watch for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a great GPS watch. For the price it can't be beat. When paired with HR strap and Polar Flow app you have all the information you could want about your runs, rides, hikes and more. Very easy and intuitive to use. Also tracks movement during the day. I use it to train for triathlons as well as get info on distance, duration, and altitude gain during hikes. I used to wear a sunto core most days and planned on this watch just for use during training but it has become my everyday wear watch as well. It also pairs with Bluetooth on iPhone so you get text and call notifications.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle H.

customer_reviews.title: Beware:  Only worked for a couple of months.  Can't sync it, so its's now virtually useless.
customer_reviews.text: I started out liking this watch, but now it simply refuses to sync - either to my iPhone/iPod through bluetooth or with a windows computer hardwired via the mini-USB cable (and I've tried it on two different Windows machines running Windows 7 and 10). I can only say that it is now virtually useless to me, and their website is useless as far as fixing this problem. I would stay as far as possible from this watch, and I will not be buying any more products from this vendor.
customer_reviews.author: BSman

customer_reviews.title: The software is awkward and does not sync smoothly. ...
customer_reviews.text: The software is awkward and does not sync smoothly. The buttons on the side to manipulate the display and programs are awkward. This is geared for the dedicated athlete at triathlon level . After I had done all I could do for the one day I wore it the display showed 4% activity. I could not adjust to my level of activity
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: But, what made me to actually decide on this was because now I can get smart notifications (for iPhone only for now).
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many running watch/fitness trainer/smart watches without success: Fitbit, Jayhawk, Microsoft Band, Runtastic, to name a few. The Microsoft Band was the one that I liked the best except it didn't look like a watch and after the new iOS was installed I kept getting repeat notifications. Anyway, I just got this one two days ago and so far I am pleased with it. It has a LOT of running functions and data. But, what made me to actually decide on this was because now I can get smart notifications (for iPhone only for now). More later when I have formulated a longer and detailed opinion after using it for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Carl T.

customer_reviews.title: This would have been a very different review a few months ago...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this watch less than six months and it will not sync to my computer or hold charge....a quick internet search will show that many other people are experiencing the same issues. I would do this research before suffering the consequences like I am. I am starting half marathon training tomorrow without a watch now. And I didn't even wear the dang thing all of the time--only on runs.
customer_reviews.author: settergal8507

customer_reviews.title: Top of the Line Fitness Tracker
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic fitness tracker. I'm really surprised Polar isn't as popular as Fitbit because Polar products are superior in my opinion. One of the biggest reasons is its durability. It is completely waterproof and can withstand any of your toughest workouts or adventures. The display looks great and you can dive into a lot of different options and features which is great. Also the battery lasts 3 weeks at a time! When I first bought this I planned on only wearing it outside of work but I think it looks surprisingly nice so I wear it 24/7. I've been very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Juice

customer_reviews.title: Loving this training watch!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the Polar M400 for about 2 weeks now, and I love it! The GPS gets a quick fix, after your first initial link up. The system is easy to use and read, and I have already gained some valuable training insight for myself. It feels great on my wrist, and i havent had to charge it again after the first time ( I have used the GPS about 6 times for 30-40 mintues each time since the first charge). The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because sometimes it takes multiple tries to get the data to sync wireless from the watch to my phone.
customer_reviews.author: TheDoctor2250

customer_reviews.title: If you live in NYC the GPS is simply NOT WORKING
customer_reviews.text: If you live in NYC the GPS is simply NOT WORKING. No matter you wait the signal to be OK, or that you do the GPS update... I guess the building block the signal... But hey why is my phone GPS working then? Sorry Polar but i know the distance i am running and your GPS watch is not accurate. It s very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: franco

customer_reviews.title: Too sad.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work, it had some electrical problem that customer service couldn't solve. I had to return it. Too sad.
customer_reviews.author: Nestor Marsollier

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth It!!!
customer_reviews.text: It's really big and chunky on my arm. It will not re-sync and will not pair with any device. If I was not required to have this thing (for a fitness course), it certainly would not be my first, second, or third choice. Customer Service for Polar what friendly but not helpful in figuring out how to re-sync it. For me, the price and the look of it I give it a one but the quality of this thing (because this is not a watch its a thing) is a complete 0 stars. It was not due to mine being used. A student in the same fitness course purchased new and hers will not sync at all.
customer_reviews.author: MsChiefManaged

customer_reviews.title: This watch is amazing, it takes a couple seconds to find the ...
customer_reviews.text: This watch is amazing, it takes a couple seconds to find the GPS signal, but when it finds it it gives me as a runner, and a cyclist the information i'm looking for like MPH for biking and my mile split time for running. I just uploaded the activity for the first time on to the website, and it is amazing you can re live your runs and it shows a GPS picture of the area you were at and the route, where you were at on an overall map. Its super cool. I love it. It also calculates your daily activity so its fun to see which days you reach 100% and which days you don't.
customer_reviews.author: lina

customer_reviews.title: Great watch even without the Garmin name that is on the tip of everyone's tongues!
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. Been using it for 4-5 months and have no problems. The iPhone app is great for basic info and the computer app shows some great details. I'm female and it doesn't seem too big for my wrist. I wear it all the time. Like how it tracks "down time" and sleep. Even beeps at me when I've been sitting too long. Check out DC Rainmaker for the review that sold me on this particular sports watch.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Usually Polar makes excellent products, but the M400 is not among them. This fitness watch is inaccurate (heart rate, calories, and distance are wayyyyy off), plus it doesn't sync. I'm highly disappointed and will be returning this "fitness" device for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: BumbleBee7

customer_reviews.title: bought thiswatch b/c I was big into running and training for ...
customer_reviews.text: bought this watch b/c I was big into running and training for a marathon. The watch served my purpose well. Since I originally purchased the watch it has gone through many updates, for the better. The company is constantly providing updates to my watch. it now syncs w/strava, also provides smartphone notification of calls and texts. It's a pretty good watch for running and everyday use. The GPS also seems pretty accurate. I used it for my marathon and it was within .2 miles of my the course, which to me is pretty close.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: The perfect tool to get me up and going
customer_reviews.text: I work in an office, so the hourly reminders that I need to move are exactly what I need. I use in daily walking and running, and it has a great battery life - just needs to recharged every few days if using daily, or once a week or so if the GPS isn't activated for long periods of time. The swimming feature didn't work quite as well as I hoped, but that may have been because I was indoors. PC app is also great and is easy to navigate. The perfect waterproof exercise companion!
customer_reviews.author: Lacey D. Sutton

customer_reviews.title: I am overall happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I have mine since Aug 2015. I am overall happy with it. I little too big for woman but you get used to the size. It connects well with the bluetooth chest strap connector and I use the GPS feature all the time. I am sending it now to POLAR repair since it stopped syncing with the software. Its just too new to be repaired!!!!! Before the problem I was happy with my purchase and I even bought one for my husband. We used to wear the polar loop so with this watch you don't need the loop anymore. It tracks your sleep and daily activity.
customer_reviews.author: Bia

customer_reviews.title: Has good features and the sync to mobile is good
customer_reviews.text: Have had more basis polar HRMs in the past and the GPS on this model was an upgrade. Has good features and the sync to mobile is good. The sync to computer is less good. I had to have the USB port on the watch replaced as apparently it had become corroded.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome device. This is my first GPS watch and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome device. This is my first GPS watch and its much more than I expected. Partly because there is so much information that can be mined. I doubt that the majority of users will take advantage of all this device can do but I certainly am. Polar flow is a must to really experience the power. The iOS apps are good and syncing is a breeze. I highly recommend this for any serious or casual fitness enthusiast. This is a great value. Absolutely no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. C

customer_reviews.title: Great fitness watch, looks modern and clean too.
customer_reviews.text: Love this fitness watch. I have gotten many compliments on it. I enjoy all the customizable features on it. I mostly use it for running and HR monitoring. I paired it with a scosche rhythm plus forearm HR monitor (  ) which works GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: pvfanatic

customer_reviews.title: Lasted only 7 months ,Next time buy Garmin
customer_reviews.text: 7 months after regular usage and being extremely cautious protecting my M400, wristband is detaching from monitor. I contacted Polar Customer Service by mail and the reply was "Thanks for contacting us. To buy a new one call 0800.. Option 4 and place your order.." I then contacted them by chat and told me to reach a service center and they would determine what to do under their criteria. Meanwhile my wife had a similar issue with Garmin Fitbit, they have already sent her a new one to our adress.
customer_reviews.author: Sigi

customer_reviews.title: Features are good, but it cannot hold a charge...
customer_reviews.text: Watch cannot hold a charge - I bought this watch which was recommended by Orange Theory Workout (Best Workout according to NY Times and I agree). The watch offers great features and look very well made.This watch was compatible with their systems. Unfortunately, if I charged the watch in the morning before work, it would die either just before class or in it. At the same time I bought my daughter a Fit-bit Surge for Christmas and it works great and holds a charge for several days.
customer_reviews.author: Brett A. Machtig

customer_reviews.title: Polar Flow has a lot of useful info and takes a little getting used to
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoying the M400 so far. GPS acquisition is a bit slow sometimes, but that's not a big deal for me. Polar Flow has a lot of useful info and takes a little getting used to, but I really like it a lot compared to the competition such as Garmin's MyConnect. I usually sync via USB on my PC, and the sync via BT is always reliable on my iPhone 5, but I've tried everything I know and can't get it to sync with my Nexus 7 (Android). That's a shame, too, because the Flow app looks great on the tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Roostalee

customer_reviews.title: It blocks the Heart Rate monitor signal to be used with other devices (like a phone app)
customer_reviews.text: I love my M400 but I hate the fact that it blocks the signal from the HR strap to be shared, so I can't have nice voice feedback from my Polar Beat app (which the watch does not provide), The PolarFlow app is a bubble where you can't share anything (at least I can export data and import it into RunKeeper), so I like to use DIgifit or RunKeeper which are more social, but after buying this watch, I either have Heart Rate signal for the M400 or for other apps, not both. Sometimes want to return it, but I really like it, I hope they fix this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jairo E. Benavides

customer_reviews.title: I love my M400
customer_reviews.text: I love my M400, but 4 stars only because this causes rashes! I cannot wear it overnight without it causing some sort of minor rash on my wrist. I have changed my use and remove it at night, but now I don't get the sleep tracking. Still an awesome fitness tracker and perfect running watch. Latches on to GPS in just about 30 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Dipankar Mitra

customer_reviews.title: Short Battery life 3hr
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised except battery life of 3.5 HR (with GPS and HR) which is only a fraction of the advertised 6 to 8 hours. Sent watch to manufacture because of short battery life but came back with same problem. When I complained about the issue not being resolved Polar said they would replace it with a new one which they did but STILL have approximately a 3 Hour battery life (no syncing, no extreme temperatures, no excuses). I reached out to Polar for help and looks like I wasted my time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best value full featured watch
customer_reviews.text: I searched a long time and tried several other watches before settling on this one. It's very light, can be configured to give you 4 lines of data, is easy to use, and is priced very well considering all the features it has. Check out an in depth review here -  I also use the Scosche Rhythm plus heart rate monitor which I also rate 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Watch stops charging after 3 months of intensive use
customer_reviews.text: Watch has excellent features, good battery life in between charging. Even the screen and font type is really good and clear to read while running. I really enjoyed it for the first 3 months, after which it simply stopped charging when connecting it to the usb cable. Customer service is poor. A real pitty rhat such a well designed watch has such a simple fatal flaw which makes it useless!
customer_reviews.author: LIMAPO

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bad experience. First I had syncing issues now the watch wont charge. Had watch about 5 weeks....soooo frustrated....
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch/Terrible Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: This is a great running watch! TheOnly problem is if you need to reach polar for customer care. Customer care at polar is terrible. If anything goes wrong with your watch you will have to mail it to NY as it is the only way to it repaired when it is under warranty. So if you are using to keep track of your training plan you better have plan B. By the way, do not even try to call customer support; the are rude and arrogant. My friend​ who had a similar issue with his watch got it replaced immediately by Garmin. If you are deciding between a Polar and a Garmin watch I would go for Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: AVOID POLAR
customer_reviews.text: I've had polar before and it was a decent unit, usually failing conveniently at 2 years. This unit a month in - Buckle failed, gps failed, buckle failed again, crap. Total crap, polar won't cover shipping,
customer_reviews.author: Keepin straight

customer_reviews.title: It is great in counting steps and calories
customer_reviews.text: i already had the chest strap. It is great in counting steps and calories. it's helped provide me with those numbers to keep up with my caloric intake/macros goals. i love it . I have used it in our gym the signal is blocked for gps and also in the water the signal is blocked. but other than that it's great
customer_reviews.author: Kady Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good gps watch but a little slow syncing connection with the iphone app
customer_reviews.text: The watch is really good and accurate, but only I can be disappointed about the connection with the iPhone app, it is really slow to sync the activity which take like 10-15 minutes to do it and several times it shows me the "error" sign. You better improve this or you will never compite with Garmin... After all I could say is good.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Delepiani

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: Simply said, the documentation on this product is not the greatest. Must have a bit of an aptitude to work out the finer point. Other than that this is a great product. Recommend the Heart rate monitor with this product. To connect with computer one uses a usb cable. The part that plugs into the M400 is terrible. After just a few months I can no longer connect my device, which means it cannot charge and rendered useless. What a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: dosha

customer_reviews.title: Polar M400 has great GPS, good (and improving) apps for Android
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after trying a Timex Ironman GPS for a while, and wish that I had just spent the money on the M400 to start with. Polar M400 has great GPS, good (and improving) apps for Android, great HRM with Bluetooth reception, and lap/interval/distance measurement. My next purchase is the cycling cadence monitor. No music or social media on your wrist, just good data tracking. Some may prefer Garmin or the a device that has social media/text/music capability, but this is very reliable and was an excellent choice for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great for athletes
customer_reviews.text: great for athletes , the only thing I don't like is that the battery would only last a couple of hours
customer_reviews.author: Manuel

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with my Polar M400 because the information a get ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with my Polar M400 because the information a get about my runnings: length, time, calories, etc. and the map of my routines through the web of Polar flow. However, lately I'm having problems to charge my watch with the USB cable, it doesn't connect well. I wonder if I can use another similar cable, or it has to be a Polar USB cable only?
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Guachalla

customer_reviews.title: Really nice functions, but connector won't last
customer_reviews.text: The watch is great and I love the functionality...until it breaks. I've owned 2, both broke before a year was out. The micro USB connector used to recharge the device (and upload data) is a fragile connector, and hidden behind a silicone flap that makes it hard to see where things need to be plugged in and at exactly what angle. Guess what. It breaks...even if you are trying to be careful and attentive to the problem. Once it's broken, the watch is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't make the same mistake I did!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Polar M400 based on positive reviews regarding the variety of features. However, when it arrived I spent an entire afternoon trying to sync it with my phone - using all the recommended ways. Since I was unable to reach customer service to resolve the issue, I read many customer reviews on a number of sites (including Polar Forums) about the tremendous difficulty syncing with phones. It went straight back in the box for a return and I bought a Garmin Vivoactive instead. Don't make the same mistake I did - it is less expensive than comps like the Vivoactive and FitBit Surge because it's not as reliable to sync with your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Hoeke

customer_reviews.title: Great for running and the updates that Polar has been ...
customer_reviews.text: Great for running and the updates that Polar has been making are awesome. I really like this watch, it's perfect for running. The digits on the watch are big enough for me to read. I have also used this watch when doing boot camp classes with my heart rate monitor. The app that goes with this is awesome and I can check my heart rate from the watch and see my progress from the app.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love my band
customer_reviews.text: Love my band. I recommend it to everyone as a solid tracker without an incredible price tag. The app can be a bit hit or miss and it can take a while to sync with the band if you don't do it regularly. Only real con for me though is the lack of a vibrate option.
customer_reviews.author: Luke H

customer_reviews.title: Not recommend anybody if you are swimming  Polar need to fix this product .
customer_reviews.text: I have this product before and it’s sealed on the charging port and I’ve been using for three years and it broke the strap so I buy a new one and this one didn’t come with the sealed USB port rubber.I don’t know if make like this
customer_reviews.author: jello

customer_reviews.title: You get what you see
customer_reviews.text: This watch simply does everything it says it does. No more, no less. You get what you see, no problems. The battery is good, the gps is fast and as accurate as you could expect. This is a good buy if you want a fitness tracker and sports watch cross over. It does both well.
customer_reviews.author: house tracker

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 6 weeks.  Rubbish interface and too easy to accidentally stop recording during a workout
customer_reviews.text: Used three times a week for the last 6 weeks then the buttons stopped working. When it worked it was fine. I could overlook the clunky user interface, infuriating screw ups with recording during a workout and the non intuitive nature of the watch. It's pathetic that nowadays you can't make a solid state watch that lasts more than 6 weeks!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Polar is the real deal.
customer_reviews.text: Fast and accurate GPS. Always synchs with my heart rate monitor. Quick and easy upload to an on line app which has a wealth of information available. I want to get up and run and not putz around with my sports equipment. This lets me do that and then review the results afterwards. This is my 3rd Polar watch over the last 20 years. Even the first one still works, just wanted newer features. Polar is the real deal. Don't putz around!!
customer_reviews.author: Mel Pel

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't sync to computer or mobile device.
customer_reviews.text: The watch is super nice and does everything I want it to do....except to the Polar Flow site and my mobile device. We downloaded the app to the computer just as the directions said, however the computer nor the mobile device would recognize the watch. I hated to return the watch...further review of the watch said similar problems experienced by other customers. If you don't want the watch synced to a mobile device, it is great and a definite purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Best HR / Watch Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. I didn't want to wear both a watch & a "fitness monitor." I already had the Bluetooth chest strap, so this watch frees me from carrying my phone on workouts. Battery lasts long time. I love that it displays the first few lines of an incoming text & phone number of incoming calls. Gives lots of data on watch display. Even more data on phone or computer. Training programs are great. LOVE it!
customer_reviews.author: Sekou B. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected, but the watch is cracking around ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected, but the watch is cracking around the back. I don't know how long it will last or if the waterproofing will hold up. Luckily I bought it mainly for the heart rate monitor, not the watch.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Person

customer_reviews.title: Great all-around running and fitness watch
customer_reviews.text: I would highly recommend Ray's review on dcrainmaker.com. I knew exactly what I was getting - basically a replacement for the Polar RS 200 that I beat up for many years. The down side is that the heart rate monitor doesn't work in the water, as most all of Polars watches do. Still, that's a small price to pay for GPS thati never had with the RS 200. The fitness stuff is ok. No vibration alerts and no heart rate tracking while asleep, like many fitness trackers do. Polar Flow is a good app and the online data tracking is very good. I like the ease with which I can modify the watch display via the web app.
customer_reviews.author: David P. Lindee

customer_reviews.title: A Great Sports Watch!
customer_reviews.text: A really solid sports watch that stands up to the elements and workouts. Polar has a pretty solid software package to the capabilities that come along with this watch really make it a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Arianne

customer_reviews.title: Expensive wristband replacement
customer_reviews.text: As far as I can tell the only way to get a replacement wristband for the Polar M400 is through Polar customer support. I was told by Polar customer support the original wristband's warranty is for 6 months. For a replacement, I was charge $32.50! That inclues shipping and handling but not tax. Also, the replacement wristbands warranty is only good for 3 months. I like the watch, but you might want to factor that in to your decision. Mine band broke at 20 months.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Paton

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried to contact the seller with no luck. I haven't had this product long and it has already stopped working. At first it didnt keep a charge and now that it has a full charge it wont work at all. Don't by this product at all.
customer_reviews.author: Ericka

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: Polar always seems to have quality issues and this is no exception. The band is already separating from the bezel, which is a weird problem to have. Otherwise it works as advertised, great for jogging, hiking and walking. I have a hr monitor and syncing is easy enough. For the price, a very good deal. The quality of the adhesive is my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: name

customer_reviews.title: Overall I think it is very useful for when you are any stationary machine
customer_reviews.text: The watch has done everything it was suppose to except, the watch will not sync to the polar app so that I can log the calories I have burned. Overall I think it is very useful for when you are any stationary machine. Because it shows you what heart rate you are at.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to wear
customer_reviews.text: This watch does the basics, current pace, avg pace, and distance, flawlessly. It is easy to wear, connect and charge. I've found that most of the more expensive fitness watches don't do these basics properly. This is a great watch for basics and that is all you need (versus an inaccurate heart rate wrist reading, inaccurate cadence readings, non working ability to store music etc etc)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I've found the hardware to be great. Good size and easy to read display
customer_reviews.text: I've found the hardware to be great. Good size and easy to read display. The watch is helpful while running: The GPS works well and the battery seems to last 1-2 weeks when running 4X's a week. However, syncing the watch has been a nightmare. The whole purpose of buying the watch was to track runs, compare workouts, track progress, and tally total miles. Without the ability to sync I can't do any of this.
customer_reviews.author: Bru

customer_reviews.title: I recommend it for the price! Great value.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to get myself back into running, and have been pleased with it as a recreational runner. It does take 5-10 seconds to find the GPS signal, but you can just use the time to stretch. Battery life seems reasonable. If I go on 2-3 runs sequentially (total of 6-10 miles) it will definitely need recharged.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good training watch and very good price relative to others in the category!
customer_reviews.text: Good product at a very good price! For a good intermediate sport watch my M400 continues to provide ease of use and good mix of features. Hope Polar continues to provide firmware updates with new/enhanced features for awhile longer.
customer_reviews.author: Joe G

customer_reviews.title: Great fitness tool!
customer_reviews.text: Nice watch, great functionality and very accurate. Definitely prefer this to the fitbit!
customer_reviews.author: Leticia Stryker

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the product. Has everything I want in a workout watch.
customer_reviews.author: JJohnson

customer_reviews.title: Great activity watch
customer_reviews.text: Great activity watch! It has an activity meter that you set in the beginning that makes you want to complete your daily activities in order to fill the meter up. My only problem with it is it beeps every time you go to pick up your ball or golf club when you golf. It is worth the price just for the meter, set it high so you have to fill it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Underhill

customer_reviews.title: I love it! It really motivates me to reach my ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it ! It really motivates me to reach my goal every day , I haven't had any problems with it . I swim with it every day .
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome running watch
customer_reviews.text: This watch does everything a runner would need. The estimated finish timer is awesome. Especially if your job does fitness tests, ie. Military, police, fire. product_meta.title: Polar M400 GPS Smart Sports Watch
product_meta.description: Developed for runners who want a comfortable and durable running watch with sporty design and advanced GPS and training features. Track and record running as well as your other exercise, and monitor your performance accurately. Connect with the Polar Flow mobile app and stay active and motivated.
feature_bullets: GPS WATCH: Built-in GPS technology keeps track of your pace, distance and altitude
FITNESS TRACKER: Tracks your workouts, steps, distance, calories burned, sleep quality, and activity 24/13
WATERPROOF FITNESS TRAINER: Use the fitness tracking watch to keep an eye on your running cadence to improve your running efficiency and avoid injuries in all weather conditions
ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY: Compatible with H7 Heart Rate sensor to train at the right intensity with target heart rate zones
SOCIAL SMARTWATCH: Plan, sync and share your training using the Polar Flow app and web service
